page.title: 04Local History pre 1939.
page.content:
Bilbrough before 1939.
There are many older people in the village now,some of whom have spent most of their lives here. Miss Atkinson aged 89 and Mrs Totty aged 77 live together at Rose Cottage. They were born here.There were no new houses then.In 1939 the Lycett Green family lived in the Manor, and there was a full staff of servants.Most of the villagers worked for them.There was a post office and a shop and an orphanage.There was a smithy and a waterworks.All these have gone. The houses and the church were lit by oil lamps and candles.Electricity was brought to the village after the war. Main sewerage was installed in the 1950s.These ladies remember this work taking place.
